> In short, the =
history came alive in that set of somewhat

 sliding doors. And that is why, dear

That's why I love going to Japan - I had a moment like that in 2001,=

where I stood in the very spot Toyotomi Hideyoshi held his final Grand
Kit=
ano tea ceremony.  I was looking at the exact landscape everyone in
attenda=
nce would have seen, although a lot of cherry trees had been
planted since =
then. It's sort of awe inspiring experiencing that sort
of thing.
